intro: Tridax mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and produce wind-dispersed seeds. Tridax mexicana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
